column4: i need some help sshing to my box at home (yes it has openssh installed, and yes it's listed in dmz on the router) i need help setting ssh up to actually connect to it
times out...all i know how to do is use the network ip, how do i direct it on to the machine i want? (192.168.1.5)
ar you trying to connect to that ip from outside your home network?
you need to connect using the external ip, and have your router configured to forward that to the internal ip
can you connect from another box on your lan?
it's on the dmz list of my router...shouldn't that be enough?
it might be trying to do a reverse dns lookup, then timing out...
if i just did: ssh <WAN ip> would that work?
yeah, add your username though  user@ipaddress
it just sits and blinks at me in terminal...any ideas?
there might be some ssh configs you could change, your work might block port 22, you might need to change router settings
i doubt it, i work at a college >.>
check your logs at home, see if there are any failed attempts or clues there
aww, bummer...i was hoping to start tinkering with it tonight :/
can you ping your home box?
